result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine Cheyenne Farr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Arrested FOSO
Payment Plan Order

Called 3:19 p.m. FTR recorded. Also called 14CM238. Christine Farr appears in person and requests monthly payment plan. CC combines both cases into one payment plan and orders $300/month commencing 7-10-15.
Payment hearing at 06-16-2015 03:00 pm
for payment plan
of non-payment; application for commitment order/license suspension; order
Does not plan to seek.
State's Settlement Recommendation

Defendant Christine Cheyenne Farr in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also called 14CM238. Called 1:29 pm. Resolved. Change name from Kroening to Farr. 14CF120 - amend count 1 to DC $1000, amend count 2 mis theft $500 plus costs. 14CM238 - restitution paid prior to court today and will be amended to county ordinance $100 plus costs. 14CM238 court amends count 1 pleads NC $100 plus costs 60 DTP/CO. Count 2 DRI. Apply restitution. 14CF120 court amends count 1 to FC disorderly - pleads G - $1000 plus costs 60 DTP/CO - count 2 amended to mis theft - reads new penalties - pleads NC - court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering her plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering her plea and waiving her right to JT, factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guility of count 2 as amended to misdemeanor theft. JBC/Arbuckle nothing further. Farr withholds statement. Court sentences to following $500 plus costs 60 DTP/CO. Appeal rights Adjourned1:37 pm
Final pre-trial on February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Called at 3:02 PM. Also called 14CM238. Christine Farr/Kroening appears in person and with counsel Paul Arbuckle. State appears by Charles Simono. Arbuckle - waiving PH, provides court with waiver form. Court has waiver form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial, proceed to ARGN. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Arbuckle has Information, waives reading of it and will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on both cases, set both matters for FPT on 2/11/15 at 1:30 PM.
and certificate of appearance - Deputy CJ

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on January 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 9:00 AM. Also called 14CM238. Christine Farr appears with her attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Jodie Bednar-Clemens appears for the State. Defendant has complaints, waives further reading of both complaints, requests PH on 14CF120 and plead NG to all counts on 14CM238. Court accepts NG pleas on CM case, will track at STC with 14CF120. State - bond - 14CM238 - $1000 sig bond. No objections. Court - 14CM238 - $500 sig bond. Arbuckle waives time limits for PH.  Court sets 14CF120 for PH on 1/8/15 at 3:00 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 3, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Called at 9:54 AM. Christine Farr appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Jodie Bednar Clemens. Farr has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Clerk informs that she was already read her charges and penalties. Farr states she was given an extension on previous date to look for an attorney - tried to hire one - thought she had Mr. Kennedy but states that she was instructed by Attorney Kennedy that the Court does not have the authority to give her a specific amount of time to get an attorney. Court responds, will give the defendant one last adjournment and gives ramifications of appearing without an attorney at the next hearing. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 12/3/14 at 8:45 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christine Cheyenne Farr
Current: 4007 County Road W, Crandon, WI 54520   (Effective: 09-22-2014)
Prior: 4007 County Highway W, Crandon, WI 54520
Adjourned initial appearance on October 8, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Called at 9:00 AM. Christine Farr appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. State provides defendant with complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Farr understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, will hire her own. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 10/8/14 at 9:45 AM, gives ramifications of appearing without an attorney.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim, BK.
Signature bond set.
